name: v7.0.0
body:
For each Cycle Hollow will now publish a Header (same as Snapshot header) containing all the schemas available in a snapshot header.
This can be used to view schema changes without having to download a Blob 

HollowProducer#Publisher#publishBlob has been deprecated in favor of Publisher#publishArtifact which takes either Blob or HeaderBlob

HeaderBlob is a wrapper around HollowHeader

name: v6.4.1

name: v6.4.0
body:
#551 Added two new generated API styles:

* **Performance API:** A consumer API which allows for traversal of a dataset without ever creating POJOs. Instead, record handles are `long`s (called `Ref`s). The high bits of a `Ref` contain a type identifier, and the low bits contain the record's ordinal.
* **Unit testing API:** A typed producer API which allows for quick creation of data states within unit tests.

name: v6.0.0
body:
This major version release discontinues the use of `unsafe.putOrderedLong` in favor of `unsafe.putLong`. `unsafe.putOrderedLong` was used defensively, but it caused SIGBUS on ARM.

ARM is not officially supported at this point, but this release unblocks operation on ARM for further battle hardening.

This release is backwards compatible on x64.

name: v5.0.0
body:
This major release contains breaking changes and supports shared-memory mode for Hollow Consumer. The producer side is unchanged, so operationally the shared memory consumer is backwards compatible with previously produced blobs. As for code changes, breaking API changes are limited to classes that aren’t expected to be consumed externally and have no searchable usages. Still if any breakages, fixing forward should be straightforward.

Shared memory mode for Hollow Consumer mmaps a snapshot blob to virtual memory and lazily loads only 4k-sized pages of accessed portions of data to physical memory (off JVM heap). This is useful for local debugging using large Hollow datasets, that wouldn't otherwise be possible if the entire dataset were to be eagerly loaded on heap. In future, shared memory mode can also prove useful in deployed environments for faster app init and RAM savings. For now, only initial load using a snapshot is supported, and indices live on-heap.

name: Bugfixes and doc changes

name: v4.7.10
body:
- Fixed `HashIndex` selection to return correct results (#434)
Prior to this fix it was possible for the selection field path to be resolved to an incorrect enclosing type.  In effect this results in "type confusion" where ordinals for one type state are assumed to be associated with another type state. Thus when using the selection field path the match results might be incorrect.

name: v4.7.0
body:
Incremental producer API, see `HollowProducer.Incremental`.  This replaces the beta API `HollowIncrementalProducer` which is now deprecated and will be removed in a subsequent major release.

An incremental producer is built from the same builder as a _standard_ producer with a call to the `buildIncremental()` method.  As such it is configured in the same manner, and a cycle proceeds through the same stages of population, publish, integrity check, validate, and announce.  A hollow consumer does not know if a producer is incremental or not.

There are two main differences:

1. An incremental cycle is performed by the `HollowProducer.Incremental.runIncrementalCycle`.  This follows the same pattern as the _standard_ producer but only changes, rather than the whole state, are reported.

2. An incremental cycle has an additional incremental stage, events of which can be received by registered instances of `IncrementalPopulateListener`.

name: v4.6.4
body:
- Enable a `HollowProducer` listener to veto a cycle.  Ordinarily runtime exceptions thrown by a listener will be caught and not re-thrown.  A listener method receiving an event may throw `VetoableListener.ListenerVetoException`, or the listener may implement `VetoableListener` for a method receiving an event to re-throw any runtime exception.

- Deprecate `HollowObjectSchema.addField` that accepts a parameter of type `HollowTypeReadState`.

- New events in the added for `PublishListener` for

    1. Staging of blobs. This enables operation on blobs before they are published

    2. Asynchronous publishing of a snapshot blob if the producer is built with a snapshot publish executor that publishes asynchronously.  The event receives a `CompletableFuture` that completes when the blob has been published.  This ensures events are emitted and received sequentially and in order.

- Improvements to the listener tests.

- HollowProducer supports HollowObjectHashCodeFinder for legacy cases (#410)

- Optimizations to HollowCombiner for one input, and better support for ignored types (#409)

name: v4.0.0
body:
This major release has the following features and enhancements with breaking changes:

- New validator API. The validator API was transitioned from a beta API to a final API.

- Refactored the producer listener API.  The `HollowProducerListener` interface now extends from a distinct set of interfaces that correspond to stages in a production cycle.  Listener implementations may selectively implement one or more of those listener interfaces and register. The `HollowProducerListenerV2` interface was removed, for its replacement see `CycleListener` and its method `onCycleSkip`

- The `HollowProducer` builder API now has a constructor that accepts its builder.

Other changes of note are:

- Specify runCycle to return the latests announced version. #323

- Remove support for __assigned_ordinal fields of type int. #317

- Fix HollowWriteStateEnginePrimaryKeyHasher to correctly retrieve fields values #310
In some rare cases this might result in the production cycle failing on an integrity check. If such a case arises it is recommended the producer does not restore from a prior data state for one cycle.

name: v4.0.0-rc.1
body:
- new validator and listener API (#296)
- remove support for `__assigned_ordinal` fields of type `int` (#317)
  (Such fields will be ignored as is the case of any type except `long`)

name: v3.4.2
body: * ☂ fix concurrent addition/removal of consumer refresh listeners (#304)

name: v3.4.1
body: ☔️  revert narrowing of type parameter in index base classes (#297, #285)

name: v3.4.0
body:
* 💔 tighten up type parameters in generics (#295, #285)
* ☔️ fix `HollowPrefixIndex` when used with duplicate strings (#271)
* 🐣  Support the removal of historical states from history (#270)
* ✨ Improve performance when round-tripping state engines (#287)
* ☔️ Surface invalid usage of `WriteState` sooner (#284)
* 🐣 generated unique key indices now implement `UniqueKeyIndex` (#281)
* ☔️ Use transient and long value for __assigned_ordinal (#280)
* ☔️ Use volatile reads for optimistic reading of state within a loop (#279)
* ☔️ Fix reads in sparse bit set and prefix index (#278, 277)
* ✨ Documentation updates (#283, #275, #274)
* ✨ Update version of the gradle wrapper and the nebula.netflixoss plugin (#276)

## Tighten Up Generics

Two **potential breaking changes** were made in `HollowConsumer.Builder`:

1. The class definition changed from:

    ```java
    public static class Builder<B extends HollowConsumer.Builder> { … }
    ```

    to:

    ```java
    public static class Builder<B extends HollowConsumer.Builder<B>> { … }
    ```

    I.e. the addition of `<B>` making it a recursive definition

2. Method `withGeneratedAPIClass` signature changed from:

    ```java
    public <T extends HollowAPI> B withGeneratedAPIClass(Class<T> generatedAPIClass) { … }
    ```

    to:

    ```java
    public B withGeneratedAPIClass(Class<? extends HollowAPI> generatedAPIClass) { … }
    ```

These are source compatible changes, but *may* be binary incompatible. If you encounter linkage errors, rebuilding should resolve them. If you run into issues, reach out in open a GitHub issue with details and link to it in Gitter chat.

name: v3.3.0
body:
* ☔️ Fix NPE in hollow history triggered by removing a primary key across data versions
* ✨ New `ObjectModificationValidator` to validate all objects changed in a cycle
* ✨ Ability to specify time zone in History UI
* ✨ Allow callers to block on or receive a callback for a consumer's initial load of data
* ☔️ Make it less likely to inadvertently share refresh listeners across consumers
* ☔️ Explicit failure when attempting to add null to collections or maps (#253)
* ✨ Ensure exceptions are reported, rather than swallowed, with executor tasks so that failures surface closer to the source.
* ✨ More precise exception catching
* ✨ Improve performance when converting a write state to a read state
* ✨ Replace `.printStackTrace()` with SEVERE log (#257)
* ✨ Reduce boilerplate code using Java 8 idioms & miscellaneous cleanup

## ObjectModificationValidator

This validator runs a provided [BiPredicate](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/function/BiPredicate.html) on every instance of an object that was modified in a cycle. This "filter" function is called with the old object as the first argument and the new object as the second argument. If the function returns `false`, this validator is marked as failed and the producer cycle fails.

Note that the filter function is not called with any objects that were added or removed. 
Also note that this validator can only be used on types that have a primary key.

Example usage - note that `Movie` and `MovieAPI` are generated classes:
```
producerBuilder.withValidator(new ObjectModificationValidator<MovieAPI, Movie>(
        "Movie",
        (oldMovie, newMovie) -> oldMovie.getName().equals(newMovie.getName()),
        MovieAPI::new,
        (api, ordinal) -> api.getMovie(ordinal)));
```

## Future for a consumer's initial data load

The method `getInitialLoad()` returns a future which is completed when a consumer has loaded its first data set after construction. This allows callers to block, for instance, until a consumer is ready:

```
HollowConsumer consumer = builder
  ...
  .build();
CompletableFuture<Long> future = consumer.getInitialLoad();
future.join(); // block indefinitely
```

Other methods on `CompletableFuture` allow callers to block with a timeout or supply an async callback.

This should replace the need for an explicit call to `triggerRefresh()` on consumers constructed with an announcement watcher (note: the `AnnouncementWatcher` implementation still needs to call `triggerRefresh()` or `triggerAsyncRefresh()`).

name: v3.0.1

name: v3.0.0 "Roaring Corgis"
body:
The 3.0 major release of Hollow drops support for Java 7. This is a breaking change if you're using Hollow with Java 7; otherwise there are no other breaking changes in this release. When in the future we need to make another breaking change release, that will be Hollow 4.0.

## Changes in v3.0.0

* 💔 drop support for Java 7 (JDK 1.7) [breaking change]
* ✨ upgrade to Gradle 4.7

## On Java 6 & Java 7

Originally, Hollow supported Java 6 & 7 to increase its target audience. Java 6 support was silently dropped during Hollow 2.x development. As of 2018 we believe that most teams are on Java 8 or above. The support burden for Java 7 compatibility has risen as the benefits have diminished. Additionally, there are Java 8 features we want to use (default interface methods, labmdas, ...).

## Codename "Roaring Corgis"

Because corgis

![because corgi](https://media.giphy.com/media/RuP38JSfj14je/giphy.gif)

body:
- #110 Calculate producer metrics when state engine is not available. Fix for null state engine.
- #115 Make `HollowProducer` backwards incompatible with introduction of new `BlobStorageCleaner`

name: v2.8.3
body: #113 Fix issue with generated DataAccessor

name: v2.8.2
body:
- #94 Added support in `HollowProducer` to clean up the blob store with older blobs using `BlobStorageCleaner`.
- #109 Added a method to remove a listener from `HollowClientUpdater`.
- #111 Fix `HollowConsumer` for backwards incompatibility.
- #112 Reduce the access modifier for fields in `HollowConsumer.Builder`.

name: v2.8.1
body:
- #105 Support Package Grouping in generated API HollowAPIGenerator.setUsePackageGrouping(true)

- #108 Only generate [Type]UniqueKeyIndex when HollowAPIGenerator.reservePrimaryKeyIndexForTypeWithPrimaryKey(true)

name: v2.8.0
body:
- #83 API Ergonomic shortcuts for referenced types
- #97 Adding convenience methods in `ThreadSafeBitSet`
- #98 Enhancements in `HollowRecordJsonStringifier.java` and error handling
- #99 Changes in index API generators - `HollowPrimaryKeyIndexGenerator` and added new `HollowUniqueKeyIndexGenerator` to generate API's for data model that have annotations for primary and unique keys. Also, added an enhancement that returns the correct type when using the index to find objects matching the criteria
- #102 Test cleanups and refactoring
- #103 Refactoring code generation
- #104 Improving extensibility of `HollowProducer.Builder`
- #91 Enhance `HollowIncrementalProducer` with option to specify multiple threads when processing events
- #100 Update documentation
- #95 Record default hollow metrics for the `HollowProducer` and `HollowConsumer`. See `HollowProducerMetrics` & `HollowConsumerMetrics`. Use `HollowMetricsCollector` to push the metrics collected for monitoring/dashboard use cases.

Note - This release has a breaking change in #95 for all the classes that subclass `HollowConsumer`. We expect that most if not all users are insulated from this change by using `HollowConsumer.Builder`.

name: v2.7.6
body: #92 Fixed a bug in HollowSparseIntegerSet for set & clear methods when indexing using multiple threads.

name: v2.7.5
body: Add logging when a record count validator is skipped

name: v2.7.4
body: Record count change percent bug fix

name: v2.7.3
body:
- #73 Allow `HollowHashIndex` to listen for updates.
- #87 Improve index extensibility for `HollowSparseIntegerSet` and make set/clear methods thread-safe

name: v2.7.2
body:
* #78 Bug fix for the `HollowSparseIntegerSet` & improve extensibility
* #83 Ergonomic shortcuts for the generated API
* #84 Enhance `FieldPath` with 
    * ability to turn off auto-expand, 
    * another utility method to find a single value, 
    * removing auto-expand for MAP type in field path.
* Bugfix: Generated API cached delegates will no longer throw NPE when null number/boolean scalar fields are accessed

name: v2.7.1
body:
* #82 `RefreshListener` has two new available methods `snapshotApplied()` and `deltaApplied()` which are called for _every_ transition -- including for individual deltas which occur during an initializing refresh.  Access to these methods is obtained by extending `AbstractRefreshListener`.  Addresses #80.
* Bugfix: `HollowSchemaSorter` and `HollowCombiner` now work even if referenced schemas/types are filtered

name: v2.7.0
body: * #77 Adding `HollowSparseIntegerSet`, a new compact set to index sparse integer values based on a predicate for a hollow type.

name: v2.6.11
body: * Added the `RecordCountVarianceValidator`

name: v2.6.10
body: * Fixed a bug in the `HollowCombiner` when combined inputs don't contain all of the same types as initialized in the output state engine.

name: v2.6.9
body:
* `DuplicateDataDetectionValidator`: Duplicate detection based on primary key.
* Bugfix: `HollowConsumer`'s `triggerRefresh()` method threw an `Exception` if no `AnnouncementWatcher` was provided and no new data state was available
* `HollowDiff`: Better error message for mismatched schemas.

name: v2.6.8
body:
Bugfix release:

* Generated primary key index API was returning incorrect results for updated records when object longevity was enabled.

name: v2.6.7
body:
Introduced two beta APIs: 

* `HollowPrefixIndex` (#66)
* `HollowIncrementalProducer` (#69)

name: v2.6.6
body:
Bugfix release:

* #70 `HollowFilesystemAnnouncementWatcher` no longer uses a `FileSystem` watch, as this is broken on Mac OS X.
* Maintain a single `HollowReadStateEngine` throughout the life of a `HollowProducer`.  Fixes incorrect read state in the `HollowProducer` after a failed announcement.

name: v2.6.5
body: * #67 `HollowFilesystemAnnouncementWatcher` allows for specification of a `ScheduledExecutorService` and uses a `FileSystem` watch to observe changes to the _announce.version_ file.

name: v2.6.4
body:
* Reserving special values for `__assigned_ordinal` cycle tag bits
* #64 Generated APIs can be configured to aggressively substitute class names covering entire `java.lang.*` package

name: v2.6.3
body:
* Bugfix: Negative floats were encoded incorrectly
* #63 Fixed javadoc generation errors

name: v2.6.2
body:
* `HollowHistoryUI`: Simpler `HollowConsumer` based initialization.
* `HollowHistoryUI` and `HollowExplorerUI` bugfixes:
    * `HollowExplorerUI` query results are recalculated if the state engine has updated
    * `HollowHistoryUI` object diff view is recreated if the state engine has updated
    * Removed object diff view pairing timeout

name: v2.6.1
body: * VersionMinter interface is now public

name: v2.6.0
body:
* `HollowClient` API continues to be supported, but is now deprecated.
* Introducing the `HollowConsumer` API:
    * Replaces the `HollowClient` API
    * Documented at http://hollow.how/producer-consumer/#the-hollowconsumer
* `HollowProducer` API Changes:
    * No longer beta -- now officially supported
    * New builder instantiation pattern supports more options
        * `BlobStager` allows for staging blobs in places other than the filesystem (supports #49)
        * Configurable blob staging dir (still defaults to `java.io.tmpdir`)
        * Custom version identifiers
        * Out-of-band snapshot publishing
        * Custom snapshot publishing cadence (every nth cycle)
        * Blob [compaction](http://hollow.how/producer-consumer/#compacting-data)
    * Multiple validators
    * Some minor backwards incompatibilities since v2.5.4:
        * `HollowProducer.Publisher` is an interface instead of an abstract class
        * `HollowConsumer.ReadState` moved to `HollowProducer.ReadState`
* Generated APIs include convenient [index classes](http://hollow.how/indexing-querying/).

name: v2.5.4
body: * `HollowObjectMapper`: Removed theoretical possibility of memoized objects using the [`__assigned_ordinal` optimization](http://hollow.how/data-ingestion/#memoizing-pojos-in-the-hollowobjectmapper) not getting added to the state if reused across cycles

name: v2.5.3
body: * #62 Exposed subscribed `HollowClient` to subclasses of `HollowAnnouncementWatcher`

name: v2.5.2
body: * [#60](https://github.com/Netflix/hollow/pull/60) HollowObjectMapper throws IllegalArgumentException when encountering an array as field

name: v2.5.1
body:
* HollowObjectMapper: Added @HollowInline annotation
* Added ability to customize/remove generated API classname postfixes and getter prefixes
* HollowExplorer UI bugfix and improvements

name: v2.5.0
body:
* Added [Hollow Explorer](http://hollow.how/tooling/#hollow-explorer)
* Added Builder pattern for HollowClient initialization

name: v2.4.4
body:
* #51 Allow the user to specify an ExecutorService for the HollowAnnouncementWatcher.
* Updates and fixes for the beta HollowProducer API.

name: v2.4.3
body:
* #46 Converted System.out logging to java.util.logging
* #48 Better error messaging when interface fields are encountered by HollowObjectMapper

name: v2.4.2
body: HollowProducer restore enhancement to enable restore on non empty data state

name: v2.4.1
body: * HollowObjectMapper: improved optimizations related to memoization

name: v2.4.0
body:
* HollowDiff: Added ability to 'shortcut' nested types within a type diff.
* Diff/History UI: Added ability to provide 'match hints' for better collection record pairing.
* Diff/History UI: improved performance of rendering the record diff view.
* Bugfix: Fixed lost records upon HollowHistory double snapshot.

name: v2.3.1
body:
* HollowDiffUI: Fixed ClassNotFoundException in the HollowDiffUIServer and HollowHistoryUIServer
* Bugfix: Fixed edge case ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when applying deltas to unevenly sharded types
* Bugfix: Fixed StackOverflow in GenericHollowIterable (#37)
* Minor improvement to HollowWriteStateCreator
* Automatic directory creation when generating the API (#35)

name: v2.3.0
body:
* *Beta* Hollow Producer API changes
  * simplify Publisher and Blob APIs; assume all publisher implementations will stage artifacts locally
  * new `HollowProducerListener` notifications
      * data population stage start & complete
      * one notification per snapshot/delta/reverse-delta published during the publish stage
* build `hollow-diff-ui` against a non-milestone release of `jetty-server`
* remove `jetty-server` from transitive dependencies (possible breaking change: see below)

---

Callers of `HollowDiffUIServer` or `HollowHistoryUIServer` standalone servers must now provide their own `jetty-server` dependency in their builds. For example:

```
compile 'org.eclipse.jetty:jetty-server:9.4.2.v20170220'
```

Callers that already have a `jetty-server` dependency (or one provided by their container/runtime) are unaffected beyond having one fewer potential dependency conflict.

name: v2.2.5
body:
* Hollow Diff UI supports adding/removing types via a double snapshot on the HollowHistory
* Bugfix: Fixed lookup for long hash keys greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE

name: v2.2.4
body: * HollowHistory will recognize new and removed types upon double snapshot.

name: v2.2.3
body: - Minor update to beta HollowProducer API

name: v2.2.2
body:
- Beta `HollowProducer` API; high-level, cycle-oriented API for producing data states. _Unstable_

We're actively iterating on the `HollowProducer` API, tentatively scheduled for official release in Hollow 3.0. In the meantime, the API is subject to change without notice.

name: v2.2.1
body:
- Added [@HollowTransient annotation](https://github.com/Netflix/hollow/issues/21)
- Fixed HollowObjectMapper adding fields from Enum.class for enums
- Fixed GenericHollowObject not returning null for null referenced records

name: v2.2.0
body:
- PrimaryKey auto expansion
- HollowObjectMapper now supports [non-trivial class hierarchies](https://github.com/Netflix/hollow/issues/14)
- FilteredHollowBlobWriter fixes and improvements
- ObjectMapper deprecated addObject(...) in favor of add(...)

name: v2.1.1
body:
Bugfix release:
- Fixed java.util.Date serialization in HollowObjectMapper.
- Added missing Set sampling.
- Fixed potential thread safety issue in HollowMap's relativeBucket() method.

name: v2.1.0
body: Added [type sharding](http://hollow.how/advanced-topics/#type-sharding)

name: v2.0.5
body: - made `#getStateEngine`  in `HollowObjectMapper` public

name: v2.0.4
body: HollowObjectMapper throws a meaningful Exception if circular references are detected.

name: v2.0.3
body: Generated POJO classes do not memoize ordinals by default.

name: v2.0.2
body:
- Generate a basic HollowAPIFactory implementation as part of a generated API
- Include unrestored type names in Exception message if HollowWriteStateEngine restore was attempted prior to fully initializing data model types
By default, HollowObjectMapper discovers default hash keys

name: v0.1.0-rc.5
body: add group

name: v0.1.0-rc.4
body: Testing publishing
